com.Wallet.app

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.Wallet.app.Transaction

  • public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
    The Transaction class is a class of static methods that perfroms transactions on a specified account, records these transactions into the specified account and updates the database.

    The transaction record is a string in this format: "ID: {id} TYPE: {type} ACCOUNT: {account id} AMOUNT: {amount} TIMESTAMP: {date}" where id is the uniquely generated transaction id, type is the type of transaction (withdrawal, deposit, transfered) account is the account id and date is the current date in the format E yyyy.MM.dd 'at' hh:mm:ss a zzz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Transaction() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void deposit(Account account, java.math.BigDecimal amount, SqlInsertManager insert)
      Takes the account and increases it's balance by the amount specified, then records the transaction into the specified account and updates the database to reflect the changes made.
      static void transfer(Account take, Account give, java.math.BigDecimal amount, SqlInsertManager insert)
      Withdraws the specified amount from one account and deposits the same amount into the other account, then records the transaction into the specified accounts and updates the database to reflect the changes made
      static void withdraw(Account account, java.math.BigDecimal amount, SqlInsertManager insert)
      Takes the account and reduces it's balance by the amount specified, then records the transaction into the specified account and updates the database to reflect the changes made.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public Transaction()

    • Method Detail

      • withdraw

        public static void withdraw(Account account,
                            java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                            SqlInsertManager insert)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                            TransactionException
        Takes the account and reduces it's balance by the amount specified, then records the transaction into the specified account and updates the database to reflect the changes made.
        Parameters:
        account - The account to withdraw from
        amount - The amount to be withdrawn. This value is rounded up to two decimal places and must not be negative.
        insert - The SqlInsertManager used to update the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        TransactionException - Thrown when the amount specified is negative

      • deposit

        public static void deposit(Account account,
                           java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                           SqlInsertManager insert)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException,
                           TransactionException
        Takes the account and increases it's balance by the amount specified, then records the transaction into the specified account and updates the database to reflect the changes made.
        Parameters:
        account - The account to deposit to
        amount - The amount to be deposited. This value is rounded up to two decimal places and must not be negative.
        insert - The SqlInsertManager used to update the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        TransactionException - Thrown when the amount specified is negative

      • transfer

        public static void transfer(Account take,
                            Account give,
                            java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                            SqlInsertManager insert)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                            TransactionException
        Withdraws the specified amount from one account and deposits the same amount into the other account, then records the transaction into the specified accounts and updates the database to reflect the changes made
        Parameters:
        take - The account withdrawn from.
        give - The account deposited to.
        amount - The amount transfered.
        insert - The SqlInsertManager used to update the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        TransactionException
